statements: CREATE TABLE mobile_paymentsystem (payment_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT NOT NULL, amount DECIMAL NOT NULL, payment_date DATE NOT NULL)
CREATE TABLE users (user_id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE, phone_number VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL)
CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, username STRING, email STRING, phone_number STRING, balance DECIMAL);
CREATE TABLE transactions (id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT, amount DECIMAL, transaction_date TIMESTAMP);
CREATE TABLE payments (id INT PRIMARY KEY, transaction_id INT, payment_method STRING, status STRING, amount DECIMAL);

CREATE TABLE example_table_3 (
    column_1 INT PRIMARY KEY,
    column_2 INT REFERENCES example_table_2(column_1),
    column_3 INT REFERENCES example_table_2(column_1),
    column_4 DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    column_5 DATE
);

CREATE TABLE ExampleTable1 (example_id INT PRIMARY KEY, example_column1 VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, example_column2 VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE, example_column3 VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW());

CREATE TABLE ExampleTable2 (example_id INT PRIMARY KEY, example_column1 INT NOT NULL, example_column2 DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL DEFAULT 0.00, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(), FOREIGN KEY (example_column1) REFERENCES ExampleTable1(example_id));

CREATE TABLE ExampleTable3 (example_id INT PRIMARY KEY, example_column1 INT NOT NULL, example_column2 INT NOT NULL, example_column3 DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL, transaction_date DATE NOT NULL, FOREIGN KEY (example_column1) REFERENCES ExampleTable2(example_id), FOREIGN KEY (example_column2) REFERENCES ExampleTable2(example_id));
